metadata.title: CVE-2021-23995 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
When Responsive Design Mode was enabled, it used references to objects thatwere previously freed. We presume that with enough effort this could havebeen exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects FirefoxESR < 78.10, Thunderbird < 78.10, and Firefox < 88.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23995` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 88.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2
firefox-geckodriver - 88.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2
firefox-mozsymbols - 88.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '88.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2').
thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2').
mozjs78 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
